In groups G01N33/52 to G01N33/96 , in the absence of an indication to the contrary, an invention is also classified in the last appropriate place.

Documents relating to new peptides or new DNA or its corresponding mRNA, encoding for the peptides, and their use in measuring or testing processes are classified in subclass C07K or in group C12N9/00 according to the peptides, with the appropriate indexing codes relating to their use in diagnostics. alpha-D-Glucans, i.e having alpha 1,n (n=3,4,6) linkages between saccharide units, e.g. pullulan
beta-D-Glucans, i.e. having beta 1,n (n=3,4,6) linkages between saccharide units, e.g. xanthan
Galactans, e.g. agar, agarose, agaropectin, carrageenan

Heteroglycans, i.e. polysaccharides having more than one sugar residue in the main chain in either alternating or less regular sequence, e.g. gluco- or galactomannans, e.g. Konjac gum, Locust bean gum, Guar gum
Glycosaminoglycans, i.e. GAG or mucopolysaccharides, e.g. chondroitin sulfate, dermatan sulfate, hyaluronic acid, heparin, heparan sulfate, and related sulfated polysaccharides
Assays, e.g. immunoassays or enzyme assays, involving lipids
Assays, e.g. immunoassays or enzyme assays, involving terpenes
Assays, e.g. immunoassays or enzyme assays, involving peptides of less than 20 animo acids
Assays, e.g. immunoassays or enzyme assays, involving penicillins or cephalosporins
Assays, e.g. immunoassays or enzyme assays, involving synthetic organic compounds as analytes
Synthetic polymers other than synthetic polypeptides as analytes
Post-translational modifications [PTMs] in chemical analysis of biological material
acylation, e.g. acetylation, formylation, lipoylation, myristoylation, palmitoylation
addition of amino acid(s), e.g. arginylation, (poly-)glutamylation, (poly-)glycylation
addition of addition of other proteins or peptides, e.g. SUMOylation, ubiquitination
addition of carbohydrates, e.g. glycosylation, glycation
addition of nucleotides or derivatives, e.g. adenylation, flavin attachment
the magnetic material being used to coat a pre-existing polymer particle but not being present in the particle core
the magnetic material being present in the particle core
the magnetic material being dispersed in the polymer composition before their conversion into particulate form
the magnetic material being dispersed in the monomer composition prior to polymerisation
the magnetic material being dispersed in a medium other than the main solvent prior to incorporation into the polymer particle
Magnetic material dispersed in water drop
Magnetic material dispersed in oil drop
characterised by the agent used to coat the magnetic particles, e.g. lipids
the coating being pre-functionalised for attaching immunoreagents, e.g. aminodextran
characterised by small molecule linker used to couple immunoreagents to magnetic particles
Labels used in chemical analysis of biological material
Oligonucleotides as tagging agents for labelling antibodies
Non-radioactive isotope labels, e.g. for detection by mass spectrometry
Labels for detection by gas chromatography, e.g. haloaryl systems
Immunoassays for the detection of microorganisms
Detection of antigens from microorganism in sample from host
Detection of antibodies in sample from host which are directed against antigens from microorganisms
Reference solutions for assays of biological material
containing particles to mimic blood cells
containing dyes to mimic optical absorption of e.g. hemoglobin
containing added polymers to stabilise biological material against degradation or mantain viscosity or density, e.g. gelatin, polyacrylamides, polyvinyl alcohol

reference.text: casein G01N2333/4731 , albumins G01N2333/76 , polysaccharides G01N2400/10

title-part.text: containing protease inhibitors, e.g. sulfonylfluorides, chloromethylketones, organophosphates
Blood gas control solutios containing dissolved oxygen, bicarbonate and the like
Multi-analyte reference solutions containing cholesterol, glucose and the like
Screening for compounds of potential therapeutic value
Screening involving studying the effect of compounds C on the interaction between interacting molecules A and B

reference.text: e.g. A = enzyme and B = substrate for A, or A = receptor and B = ligand for the receptor

title-part.text: Screening involving studying the effect of compounds C directly on molecule A

reference.text: for a receptor A, or potential substrates for an enzyme A

title-part.text: Detection of programmed cell death, i.e. apoptosis
Use of whole organisms as detectors of pollution
Electrophoretic profiling, e.g. for proteome analysis
Chemical aspects of mass spectrometric analysis of biological material

note.note-paragraph:
1. Analysis of proteins, peptides or amino acids by mass spectrometry is classified in G01N33/6848 and G01N33/6851 .
2. Analysis of nucleic acids by mass spectrometry is classified in C12Q1/6872 , C12Q2563/167 and C12Q2565/627 .

title-part.text: Omics, e.g. proteomics, glycomics or lipidomics
Methods of analysis focusing on the entire complement of classes of biological molecules or subsets thereof , i.e. focusing on proteomes, glycomes or lipidomes
Assays involving molecular imprinted polymers/polymers created around a molecular template
Assays involving polymers whose constituent monomers bore biological functional groups before polymerization, i.e. vinyl, acryl derivatives of amino acids, sugars

note.note-paragraph: 1. The indexing codes G01N2800/02 - G01N2800/44 are based on The Merck Manual of Diagnosis and Therapy (17th. Edition, Mark Beers and Robert Berkow). 2. For diseases caused by micro-organism where the microorganism is detected, which subject matter is classified in G01N33/569 and subgroups, G01N33/571 or G01N33/576 , the present indexing scheme is not used. 3. For cancers, which subject matter is classified in G01N33/574 and subgroups, the present indexing scheme is not used. 4. When indexing in the following scheme, the organ takes precedence, e.g. inflammation of the skin is indexed with dermatological disorders and not with immunology or allergic disorders, asthma with pulmonary disorders and not with immunology or allergic disorders. Exception is made for thrombosis which is indexed with haematological disorders.

title-part.text: Disorders of carbohydrate metabolism, e.g. diabetes, glucose metabolism
Hyperlipemia or hypolipemia, e.g. dyslipidaemia, obesity
Pituitary or hypothalamic - pituitary relationships, e.g. vasopressin or ADH related
Bowel diseases, e.g. Crohn, ulcerative colitis, IBS
Liver diseases, e.g. portal hypertension, fibrosis, cirrhosis, bilirubin
Diffuse connective tissue disease, e.g. Sjögren, Wegener's granulomatosis
Rheumatoid arthritis, i.e. inflammation of peripheral joints
Osteoarthritis, e.g. cartilage alteration, hypertrophy of bone
Chronic or obstructive airway disorders, e.g. asthma COPD
Disorders of ear, nose or throat
Scaling palpular diseases, e.g. psoriasis, pytiriasis
Thrombotic disorders, i.e. thrombo-embolism irrespective of location/organ involved, e.g. renal vein thrombosis, venous thrombosis
Disorders of the spleen, e.g. splenic rupture, splenomegaly
Transplantation related diseases, e.g. graft versus host disease

Infectious diseases, e.g. generalised sepsis Note: Indexing code G01N2800/26 is not used for documents already classified in one or more of groups G01N33/569 and subgroups, G01N33/571 or G01N33/576 and subgroups
Movement disorders, e.g. Parkinson, Huntington, Tourette
Pain, e.g. neuropathic pain, psychogenic pain
Cerebrovascular disorders, e.g. stroke, cerebral infarct, cerebral haemorrhage, transient ischemic event
Psychosexual disorders, e.g. sexual arousal disorder
Coronary artery diseases, e.g. angina pectoris, myocardial infarction
Heart failure or cardiac arrest, e.g. cardiomyopathy, congestive heart failure
Arrhythmias, e.g. ventricular fibrillation, tachycardia, atrioventricular block, torsade de pointes
Vasculitis, i.e. inflammation of blood vessels
Diseases of the aorta or its branches, e.g. aneurysms, aortic dissection
Disorders of the penis and the scrotum and erectile dysfuncrion
Tubulointerstitial diseases, e.g. nephritic syndrome, glomerulonephritis
Renovascular diseases, e.g. renal artery occlusion, nephropathy
Menstrual abnormalities or abnormal uterine bleeding, e.g. dysmenorrhea
Endometriosis, i.e. non-malignant disorder in which functioning endometrial tissue is present outside the uterine cavity
Breast disorders, e.g. mastalgia, mastitits, Paget's disease
Infertility, e.g. sperm disorder, ovulatory dysfunction
Pregnancy complicated by disease or abnormalities of pregnancy, e.g. preeclampsia, preterm labour
Disorders due to exposure to physical agents, e.g. heat disorders, motion sickness, radiation injuries, altitude sickness, decompression illness
Poisoning, e.g. from bites or stings
Determining the risk of developing a disease
Predicting or monitoring the response to treatment
Further complications associated with the disease
Complex ways of combining multiple protein biomarkers for diagnosis
Lipogenesis or lipolysis, e.g. fatty acid metabolism
